page.title: 07Law And Order In Dymchurch
page.content: Dymchurch is policed by 2 constables, stationed in Orgarswick Ave.They patrol the village on foot but a motor-bicycle is available.The area they cover is from Dunstall Lane,St Mary's Bay to the Redoubt & inland to Burmarsh.In the Summer they patrol the beaches.They have no weapons but carry a truncheon,used for breaking windows in emergencies & crowd control.Road safety is part of their duties.They visit Dymchurch Junior School once a year to check pupils' bicycles & test road safety skills.The constables use portable radio transmitters to commun- icate with Folkestone police station. These transmit over a radius of 5 miles.For good reception,when on foot- patrol,they stand on the sea wall.The most common crimes in Dymchurch are theft & vandalism.
